intro: Canephora ambrensis, commonly known as the Ambrensis coffee plant, is a species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, oval-shaped berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its unique flavor profile, it is highly valued in specialty coffee markets.
